raw_comment:
I notice that for about every three players of color, there’s only one person of color who is a head coach or manager. I wonder whether each team has a similar proportion of players of color or if some have close to all and some have close to none. (Although a large majority of players are people of color either way). This impacts me and my community because of the biases and expectations that come with these kinds of patterns. In the example of sports teams and coaches/managers, there are many more white people in power even though people of color are the reason they are successful. This may keep people of color from those leadership positions in the future if change isn’t actively sought. 

A possible headline: People of Color are the Driving Force of Major League Sports Teams… But Who’s in Charge?: Racial Disparity in Sports
ace_sentences: I notice a pattern in sports teams.
For about every three players of color, there is only one head coach or manager of color.
I wonder whether each team has a similar proportion of players of color.
I wonder whether some teams have almost all players of color.
I wonder whether some teams have almost no players of color.
A large majority of players are people of color.
This pattern impacts me and my community.
This pattern involves biases and expectations.
In sports teams, many people in power are white people.
People of color contribute to the success of sports teams.
This situation may prevent people of color from getting leadership positions in the future.
If change is not actively sought, then this situation may continue.
The headline is: People of Color are the Driving Force of Major League Sports Teams, but who is in charge: Racial disparity in sports.
